body_html:
@MichaelCaraccio Since I run my project with python2, I change this command to

pip2 install --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/mac/cpu/tensorflow-1.4.0-py2-none-any.whl

and it works well. But according to my test, this only occurs when I use linuxbrew installed python. Everything works fine if I use pyenv installed python even if they are the same version 2.7.14, weird..

Anyway, thank you!
body_text:
@MichaelCaraccio Since I run my project with python2, I change this command to
pip2 install --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/mac/cpu/tensorflow-1.4.0-py2-none-any.whl

and it works well. But according to my test, this only occurs when I use linuxbrew installed python. Everything works fine if I use pyenv installed python even if they are the same version 2.7.14, weird..
Anyway, thank you!
body:
@MichaelCaraccio Since I run my project with python2, I change this command to
```
pip2 install --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/mac/cpu/tensorflow-1.4.0-py2-none-any.whl
```
and it works well. But according to my test, this only occurs when I use linuxbrew installed python. Everything works fine if I use pyenv installed python even if they are the same version `2.7.14`, weird..

Anyway, thank you!
